intro: Astronia papetaria var. novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea astronia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, clustered inflorescences of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
